Characters

View source
  • History
  • Purge
  • Talk (0)

Characters are playable heroes and can be controlled by the player in-game.

There are currently 39 playable characters, in which 5 of them are Legendary Heroes.

Different characters have a unique set of stats, skills and starter weapons (see table below). Some characters can be purchased using in-game gems, while others can only be acquired by purchasing them with real money.

The player can select a character by tapping on them in the Living Room after starting a game. Each character has their own set of skins, which are obtainable through different methods.

​​​​​

​​​​​Levelling up a character gives the following bonuses:

  • 1 : Permanent +1 health (cost: 500 gems)
  • 2 : Permanent +1 armor (cost: 1,000 gems)
  • 3 : Permanent +20 energy (cost: 1,500 gems)
  • 4 : Reduces skill cooldown by 2 seconds. Skills that can store multiple charges/uses get CD reduced by 1 second (cost: 2,000 gems)
  • 5 : Skill upgrade - Different effects for each character and skill. Affects all skills for a single upgrade (cost: 2,500 gems)
  • 6 : The character obtains a permanent buff that complements their skills/play style (cost: 5,000 gems)
  • 7 : Permanently upgrades the character's starter weapon (cost: 8,000 gems)
  • 8 : Gives the applicable material to develop the respective Summoner's Artifact (cost: 10,000 gems)

Characters as NPCs

Inside the lobby:

  • Each character has something to say when the player interacts with them.
  • They also have normal properties like the player; such as can be affected with Burn, healed and shielded by the Priestess, etc. Most of these would just occur in the Living Room, however.

In a run:

  • Unlocked characters other than the one currently in control by the player may appear in the Starting Room as NPC. They may benefit or assist the player; in some cases, there may be consequences instead. Each of these NPCs can only be interacted with once per level.
  • Standard characters in NPC form will not spawn in Boss Rush Mode.
  • Inter-dimension Traveler (NPC) only appear in Boss Room.
  • In a past version, locked characters could also appear in this fashion. However, talking to a locked character would only show a message telling that the player needs to unlock it first.
    • This still occurs in Multiplayer if the character is not unlocked for any player.
  • A character will use the last skin the player played them with, both in the Living Room and as NPCs during a run.
Character Effect
Give the player a weapon:
  • Knight: Gives a random weapon up to Epic rarity.
  • Paladin: Gives a Shield.
  • Werewolf: Has a 5% chance to give One Punch after being paid 5 coins.
  • Trap Master: Gives a Happy New Year.
  • Physicist: Gives a Ion Railgun M2, Advanced Scientific Calculator or Alien Plasma Eagle.
  • Machina: Gives a random weapon up to ?? rarity.
Assist the player as mercenary, using their initial weapon, for 1 level.
  • As NPCs, these characters have 100 health.
  • Unlike mercenaries, they do not pick up weapons on the ground.
  • Lancer may use Dragon Dive in combat.
Restore the player health or energy:
  • Witch: Restores 200 energy.
  • Alchemist: Restores 1 or 2 health. There is a small chance that he may poison the player instead.
  • Priestess: Restores 4 health.
Give the player weapon attachment(s):
  • Engineer: Gives a random attachment compatible with the current weapon.
Open a portal:
  • Vampire: Opens a blue portal, allowing the player to advance to the next floor immediately.
  • Inter-dimension Traveler (found in Boss Room): Opens a purple portal to the next Extra Floor in exchange of 100 coins or 1 max health of the player.
Provide follower(s) to assist the player for 1 level.
  • Druid: Provides a Wolf.
  • Demonmancer: Provides a Fiery Imp.
  • Trickster: Provide 2 Phantom Clones.
Give the player a plant seed or material
  • Robot: Gives a random seed.
  • Miner: Gives Ironstone, Parts or Battery.
  • Astromancer: Gives a random Magic Fragment.
Gives a random Drink.
Give the player a random challenge condition
  • Officer: Gives a random Task Board challenge condition.
  • Airbender: Gives  Meridian PatencySlightly increases max HP, movement speed, fire rate and critical rate condition, or  Meridian DisorderMax armor and max HP are fixed at 1. Max energy is fixed at 999 in rare cases.
Gives Saint Sword mount, or Speedy Cloud mount in rare cases.
Give the player a Buff Bubble:
  • Costume Prince: Gives When standing within the range of an elemental attack, its radius and damage gradually increase and its duration is extended.
  • Fighter: Gives Every 10th attack is guaranteed to crit.
  • Bard: Gives Consecutive attacks or enemy deaths drop musical notes. Picking them up increases bullet size by 10% and movement speed by 5% for 3s, stacking up to 3 times.
  • Gunner: Gives Each enemy killed: attack speed +5%, crit hit rate +5%, deviation -2, stacking up to 4 times. Lasts for 10 seconds (resets on killing an enemy)..
